comment.text:
I have been recommended to try this place a bunch of times!!!! Guys, I finally made it and got to try the Tassili Punnay Wrap mixed with mild and spicy. It had such great flavor with a hint of heat! It was very fulfilling.

Cant lie, inside is small and the lines are long! But since driving 45mins I had to stay and see whats up. But i didn't wait long, i think i got through pretty quickly and i did get a juice from there not pictured but it was handmade and was really good.

Im not vegan but i love a good taste and new healthy options here and there. The parking is a bit tight, you can either park on the side of the building or across the street in the little parking lot. Definitely worth a try

I made my own kale wrap with the chili tortilla, mixed kale, hummus, battered oysters, and their raw BBQ. First off, the raw BBQ sauce is ! The wrap as a whole is great and the amount is great for the price too! The service was great as well as their workers, I would recommend and I will be back being that it was my first time! 

P.S: the raw strawberry cream pie was really good too!

photos.caption: Made my own with Chili tortilla, mixed kale, battered oysters, hummus, Moroccan couscous, avocado, tomato.

comment.text:
The food is good.  It's raw vegan wraps.  But the service is slow as hell. Even if you place an order online don't expect it to be ready when they say. I placed an order 1 hour ago. Pick up time was 30 minutes. I arrived to the place 5 minutes after my pick up time and I'm still waiting for a wrap that has 4 ingredients for 30 more minutes. 
It's ridiculous.  
There is no reason it should take 90 minutes to fix a wrap. 
If you have 90 minutes to 2 hours to wait I recommend it but if you don't have patience just go somewhere else.

So Good! My uncle referred me to this place. He's been bragging about how good their wraps are on his instagram so I was like if I ever go to Atlanta I want to try it and I did. I'm glad I did. The food creations there are so healthy, flavorful and creative. I loved my wrap. I got the punany with spicy kale. I accidentally got a full and when they say a full, it's a full! Like it will feed you for 2 days type of full. I kinda thought $20 was expensive but it's not. It's going to take me 2 days to finish the wrap and I'm typically greedy. Lol. I felt energized after eating the wrap. It was healing. Wish I had a place like this in Miami. The staff are so sweet and friendly. I also like how the restaurant is set up in what seems like a old home. The parking is also convenient. Luckily for me the line wasn't long. It's just all around creative and I enjoyed my meal. Thank you
I love this place! The food is healthy and delicious and the staff is always friendly. Definitely try the punnay wrap.

Tassili's Raw Reality is my favorite vegan restaurant in the US, and I stop by whenever I'm in Atlanta.

Their wraps are packed with oodles of flavor, and they're pretty filling. I usually get the full size wrap and have half for lunch and the other half for dinner. 

The customer service here is solid in my experience, but I highly recommend ordering in advance to avoid a long wait (due to the high volume of customers and advance orders they get at the restaurant). They also have limited space since it's mostly grab and go. So, it could get a little uncomfortable (and awkward) if you end up having to wait for your order on their front porch in one of Atlanta's less than ideal weather conditions: humidity, rain, thunderstorms, etc. That's at least what I heard from a friend because I definitely didn't get caught in the rain after being dropped off by a Lyft driver in full on business attire. ROTFLMAO!

photos.caption: The Original Kale - Full Size (Seaweed Wrap)

comment.text: This was my first time trying a Raw Wrap. It was cold and threw me off a bit, but once I got used to it, it was delish. The sweet corn made it feel satisfying. The kale was a bit bulky, could probably do without the stems. The brownie was a nice way to bring this meal together. 4 stars because It was a little too spicy for me, but if you like spice, I can see this being 5 stars. Service was great. I came   In the evening time and it was dark, and this is the type of area you may want to stay alert and lock your doors.
Very delicious quick serve vegan option. The flavors are very tasty. I had the south of the boarder wrap and poonany wraps. Highly recommend both!

photos.caption: South of the Border - Full Size (Spinach Wrap)

comment.text: The wraps are HUGE! definitely enough for 2 people. The base for most of the wraps seems to be kale. Besides wraps they also have salads and a raw 'stew'.  Be mindful that because this is a raw foods restaurant the stew is served cold. Both the wrap and stew were seasoned well and were delicious. I opted for the gluten free option for the wrap which just means it's wrapped in seaweed... be prepared to get messy. There is limited street parking and a few tables outside. Friendly and made to order service.

This place closes at 9 pm and they stop taking orders at 8 pm. We did not know about their policy and we reached at 8:45 pm. The owner came out and said maybe you could pick something from the refrigerator. I said we are from New York and would love to try out the wraps. She said let me check and agreed to make it for us. We ordered 4 south of the border wrap half each though it was a big portion size. We asked them for extra corn and they forgot to add it. But while we were eating our dinner outside they came out and gave it to us after almost an hour which was very sweet. The wrap and the corn everything tasted so good. We could only eat half of the half size and we were full. I ate the remaining portion for the next day's breakfast. 

The space outside we were eating our dinner was pretty relaxing with a beautiful garden.

Let me just say Tassili's exceeded my expectations, which were already high btw. I've heard nothing but amazing things about this restaurant and had to finally check it out myself. Being an Atlanta native, I didn't get to indulge in the vegan scene until recent because I live elsewhere but this place did NOT miss!!!! Staff is lovely, quick on the go meals. Their raw food does leave out any flavor! So fresh & well seasoned. I got the full size wrap to save for later and the Punany tasted sooooooo yummy. I was jumping for joy inside & had to have major self control to not eat the whole thing! Even tried out some of their fresh juices (tamarind & berry lemonade) & they were very refreshing. I honestly wish there were more Tassili's in every single state because everyone deserves to experience this cuisine! Hands down best vegan spot in Atlanta.

There is obviously a break down in the system when I place an order 45mins and come to get it at the time given- for you to NOT see the order. 
The fact that it takes over an hour to get raw food is disturbing. 
Without a doubt the wraps are the best- however, I do believe a consultant is needed to help the process and flow. 
You can not go here if you have limited time- or hungry...
and some of us do not like premade wraps getting

Updating my review from over 5 years ago. Tassili's Raw Reality serves up fresh raw vegan food to the Atlanta community and you really feel good about eating their food. The taste is delicious and highly nutritious. They use fresh quality ingredients and they put a lot of quality and care into the preparation of their food. Their portions are also very large. 

I enjoy their Mandingo wrap. It is massive! Their South of the Border wrap is delicious also and if you are fan of mushrooms then you must give the Dat ISH wrap a try. 

I know many complain about the wait times however when I visited during the week in the afternoon. There was no wait and I was able to quickly place my order. Employees were very friendly and it was nice to be back here and support this place. Will definitely return again soon!

4.5/5 
Food was really really good! Super filling, eating half of the burrito kept me full for the day! Only knocking off half a point for the location, street parking and long lines for food. 

The line goes by fast but definitely need to take some time out for standing in line and also if you ordered online, there was still a little wait. 

Would go again!

The food was excellent. It was all fresh ingredients and tasty. The service was amazing. I can't speak to the Am Ian s properly because I ordered my food to go and I loved it. 
If you are looking for Vegan food this place is an option.

Let me just say I would have never found this place without my friend. It is delicious everything is raw and authentic. So many flavors just bursting when you take a bite! There will be a line when you go just make sure to have patience because the food is well worth it! I had the punany which came with kale I got it mixed with mild and spicy, coconut corn tomatoes couscous and some other things. It was delicious!

The meal is similar to when you go to a Subway or Jersey Mike's for instance they  fixed your food right in front of you so you get to pick all the topics you want. They also let you taste whatever you want to see if you want it on your wrap. I also saw that they sell soups as well and I really wanted to try some so I will be going back to try that as well.

The reason for the four stars instead of five is because there is no place to sit but that's not a deal breaker for me I don't mind getting my food and going back home. Other than that great service and friendly employees. I highly recommend it!

Went here for lunch today for a 
Delicious Kale Salad, best place in Atlanta for this salad.

I visited this restaurant about 4 times so far. Although the food is vegan, the flavor is outstanding. This restaurant specializes in vegan wraps that are succulently delicious. The wraps are healthy, with such fookale , cauliflower, okra, corn, and much more. One can get mild or spicy sauce, depending on their taste buds. The ambiance is great and welcoming. The staff is friendly and the wait is not long. If you are in Atlanta and seeking a healthy, tasty meal, I recommend this restaurant.

1000 out of 10. The food, the vibe, the service. I drove almost an hr to the city for the experience. I think I'll make this a monthly thing. THATS HOW GOOD THE FOOD IS. I'm a new vegetarian and for those of us who are nervous about vegan or raw vegan...go ahead and take your plunge here. I had the half South of the Boarder wrap, with added okra. All in a chili wrap. I also got the Moringa popcorn. AND DONT GET ME STARTED ON THE POPCORN.  just go and enjoy. Thank me later

photos.caption: Half south of the border wrap w/okra on chili wrap
Moringa popcorn and half South of the boarder wrap, plus okra in a chili wrap.

comment.text:
Ordered:
- Alapoopoolala 
- South of border
- Punany

Best of the 3 is the Punany- I ordered it spicy. My spice tolerance is high so this wasn't too spicy.

Full wrap means more filling inside-- half means less filling so doesn't mean you literally get half a wrap. Expect a lot of avocado.

These were definitely flavorful. The sweet corn really shone in the Punany. So why the 3 stars?? Cause more than half way through the wrap, I found a huge bug

Tried this spot because it was recommended by a friend. I ordered the punany wrap. It was huge, flavorful and filling. However, the kale had way too many stems. I also think it needs more protein. I would eat here again but I would customize my wrap.

You can pre- order on line. I noticed when I pulled up customers were waiting outside for orders.  Yes there is a wait but worth it. I've been trying to get to this restaurant for the longest. I decide to order on line from there website after seeing the line. It indicated approx 55 min wait however after 10 minutes s  I decided to go inside and I waited for another 5 minutes and my order was ready. When you walk in they have a line to order inside and they have a separate area for online order pickup.  I noticed while inside there was sign indicating no cash but take other payments. 
My wrap let me say it was so good. The raw wrap was so refreshing. I did the mix sauce medium and mild, black bean humus. spinach wrap with all the other stuff that came with.  There are other options to add should you choose.  All I can say it was so good. I will order again and some.

photos.caption: Punany Wrap - Half Size (Spinach Wrap) this was so refreshing and good.

comment.text:
The customer service is awful. They charge 20 dollars for a delicious vegan wrap but have horrible customer service. I placed my order ahead of time and came 10 mins after the time it was promised it to be ready. I still waited 30 mins. I waited calmly. When my food was finally ready the person working there acted like I was the problem. No, "sorry for your wait" no, "thank you for your business" nothing. Rude. 

FIX YOUR TICKETING SYSTEM. You can go in and change the arrival time to 1 hour instead of 30 mins if that is the amount of time it will take. That is an easy fix that doesn't require hiring more staff. Absolutely ridiculous.

I'm just going to put this here in hopes for a change. I have been coming here for years, and although the food is good, phenomenal actually...the wait is absolutely unbearable. I have consistently waited over 45 min to an hour for my food every time I come and I am simply tired. PLEASE get it together or STOP taking customers until you can get the wait together. Please! Today I placed my order at 9:30am in hopes that it would be ready when it opened. I didn't get my food until 12:40pm. I can't sit by and continue to be upset every time I come pay my money to a business that can't seem to get it together. 
And you forgot my Raw Bq sauce...
Not sure what is going on with this new business model that they are using but it's awful. It's very unorganized and slower than usual. They are blindly taking orders and not fulfilling them.

I write this with love! The wrap was delicious but we waited an hour for it. The customer service here truly is horrible. I ordered online in advance, and waited longer than people who stood in line to order. A woman came out the front door while I was waiting outside and said "You are still waiting for your food?!? You were here way before me!". And she was 100% right. If you have 2 hours to kill, sure check this place out. Otherwise, don't expect a single staff member to make sure you're taken care of. We were checking in on our order every 15 minutes and it still took an hour. I understand if you're short staffed- but maybe don't take online orders if you simply can't make it happen.

Always a wonderful experience and every time I'm in the area I will choose Tassili's! Had an issue but it was kindly addressed by the manager, and I appreciate that, in the interest of providing good customer service. I would say to call in your order in advance, or go there in person to avoid any mixups and/or a long wait

I write this post with love. I love supporting black owned businesses--especially when they provide a great service. I drive about 20+ minutes from my house to Tassili's, and it's always a toss up whether I'll end up leaving with food or not. Sometimes I show up and it's complete chaos. Sometimes they're so busy they they don't accept walk in orders, so you have to place your order online, which yields about a TWO HOUR wait!!  Even then, there's still no guarantee that your raw food will be ready! 

I'm currently in the restaurant as I write this review. I've been standing in line for OVER an hour at this point. Don't get me wrong--the food is delicious, but this is ridiculous!! 

The building is super old and in need of a complete renovation! There is a hole in the bathroom floor and the floor in the ordering area looks like it can implode any day now! The window unit needs to be replaced. The business is bursting at its seams--literally. I'm also concerned about the overuse of plastic wrap. When you cut into the wrap, what happens to the plastic you're cutting into? Does it go into the food we're consuming? As a health conscious restaurant, it seems like they would steer away from using plastic so much. Paper products are biodegradable and healthier to use versus flooding our bodies with micro plastics. 

When will Ms. Tassili expand the business? Why does it take so long to make raw wraps?! How about investing in your business, expanding the business, opening a second line or a second location?? Don't just bank on customers coming back because the food IS good. What about the customer's time? It shouldn't take 3 hours of my time (be it ordering ahead or walking in to order) for me to get some food! This isn't a rant. It's a recommendation. Please invest in your business with all the sales from dedicated customers and expand. It's time. 

Btw--I ended up getting my food two hours later. As I left, the line was out to the road. Smh

Absolutely do not waste your time with this place. We ordered online because we read that the line can be long, came in store probably 20 minutes later, and had to wait for our food for over 45 minutes after getting there. Honestly though, the wait time wasn't as much of an issue as the fact that the service was actually garbage. Everyone working there had this disposition like they hated being there and also hated you for being there. Also, not to mention, the inside of the store in and of itself left me wondering where the health score was. Definitely not very well kept or clean. All that for a.... Kale wrap? Lmao. I could have went to Kroger, bought all the ingredients, and made one just as good in that amount of time. The ONLY reason this is getting a second star is because the food was ~okay~ but not worth it at all.
They always deliver great nutritious plant based food and service here. I try to visit them whenever I come to Atlanta.

I can not believe how good this place is. I mean I have practiced a vegetarian diet for most of my life and have had raw food all over the US but this place here beats every single one of them with one single item. The punany wrap is a masterpiece of flavors and I find myself fighting the urge to drive to the west side every week! It is seriously the best item I've ever had and they have it down to a science. I have tried to save the money and recreate it at home but it never comes out the same. There are dupe recipes that are good but none compare to the original. Go. Try. It. Now. There is no seating and you can save yourself time by ordering ahead on Uber eats. Kind of pricey but very worth it. If they had a meal prep plan I would purchase it and let them prepare my meals for the week (manifesting here).

The service is AWFUL.  There is no way an online order made at 8:50AM has not been delivered by 3:30PM.  You spend your money and there is NO WAY to contact these people.  They don't answer the phone at all.  The food is delicious BUT it is very expensive and this level of service is unacceptable. $117 is nothing to sneeze at.  I won't be ordering from them ever again.  

Be Warned this is not an exaggeration.  This is the norm for them.
Best Vegan Wraps in Georgia Easily. Would give them 10/10 if I could. The servers very knowledgeable and the line be sometimes long but once u get through it you'll know why.

4 years later and I'm still an avid fan of this place! They survived the height of the pandemic with our support and they continue to keep me and my hubby eating healthy. The price may be a little steep, the wait loner than preferred, but the flavor and  portions are so worth it! My salad lasted 3 days! They now have a grab and go section in place of the tables inside so make sure to check that out before letting the line out the door deter you! I still believe it's the best raw vegan food, great community, and I STILL would love to see them in Peachtree Corners, Roswell, Dunwoody, or Sandy Springs! 
The moment they decide to open a location OTP... I  will invest!!

owner_replies.comment:
Give thanks Lillian!! We truly appreciate your positive review to reinforce what we are doing right!! And the plan is to expand TRR into other areas in the future. 

BTW * Please mark your calendar SATURDAY, JUNE 2 for our 6th Annual Wonderful Wizards of Raw right in TRR's backyard garden. Here's the link for more info: http://www.tassilisrawreality.com/wonderful-wizards-of-raw-extravaganza.html

comment.text: Absolutely delicious, mouthwatering, satisfying, delightful, fresh and healthy! This was one of the best decisions of my life to eat at Tassili's Raw Reality!

This morning (May 17, 2023) I came to Tassili's with my mother on the way to the airport. She is from Hawaii and wanted to grab a wrap before she got on her flight. We got there early (about 10:40) and were the 5th customers in line. 

Tassili's is supposed to open at 11 every morning however, this morning they opened late (11:10). While I was in line waiting on them to open, I called the store to literally ask them "WHY AREN'T YOU OPEN YET? AND WHY HAVEN'T YOU ADDRESSED THIS LINE OF CUSTOMERS WAITING OUTSIDE?!"...but no answer smh... When they finally open, they did not engage with any of the customers to apologize for our time wasted and their lack of professionalism.

My mother and I decided to go ahead and stay to order our food (because the 2 gentlemen in front of us left) even though at this point we are now 10 minutes behind for the airport. We end up getting to the counter to order our food only to find out (now being the 3rd customers in line) that they are already on a 30 to 35 minute wait!!!?

Now let me get this straight...this is a raw food establishment and y'all are on a 30 to 35 minute wait after we've already waited 10 minutes to get in here? How?? It do not take 30 to 35 minutes to put RAW FOOD in a spinach wrap and roll it up. Y'all fronting for reall! The food here is good but nah....ain't no way yall out here playing with people's time to create some façade of demand. Ain't no way it takes LONGER to get RAW FOOD than it does going to a restaurant that actually cooks food! Straight cap. Y'all know this stuff is already prepped from that morning or the day before. And if it's not...there's your problem right there...

I'll never spend my money at this establishment again. We ended up leaving because we didn't have the time to sit there and wait 30 to 35 minutes. This business does not have any customer service training at all. The people that spend money here deserve better.

Did I mention that I live in Buford, GA so I'm a whole hour away from this place!? My family does not live in Georgia and every time they visit they request food from Tassili's. Today, y'all lost 8 customers. We ain't coming back...

Literally this is the worst experience I've ever had with a restaurant. I've never left a review in my life but I called to get some customer service and the voicemail is full. Smh...

Okay y'all, these wraps are truly the best ever! The Punany and south of the border with spicy kale mix is incredible! I'm knocking a star because their online ordering system is really not great. They definitely need to get a better and more efficient system in place. But my god these wraps are so good! I love their Moroccan couscous as well. Must try place in the West End!!!

photos.caption: Punany Wrap - Chili Wrap) with spicy kale mix
South of the Border - Full Size (Chili Wrap)
South of the Border - Full Size (Chili Wrap)

comment.text: I had their wraps for a work lunch and was blown away by how good they were. The south of the border wrap had me reconsidering how much it's possible to love a simple wrap. Filling, all the right flavors, and SO delicious!

Hands down best Wrap / Burrito I've ever had. I'm glad they use and specify non soy vegan mayo. I had spicy kale Punany and wife had the mild. The flavor on spicy has a kick and is perfect. I couldn't believe how much kale they put and didn't believe they were gonna be able to wrap it but they did. Overall this place while not much to look at on outside, the food is absolutely spectacular and they are the best at what they do.

Probably has some good food, but the proprietor needs to learn how to run a restaurant. We showed up not long after Tassili's opened, only to be told that they were not taking walk-in orders ~ we needed to order online. We saw all sorts of people standing around waiting, so we asked how long it would take to get our order. The person told us, "I don't know, just order your food and it will tell you how long." Then the owner came out and told us it would be at least 45 minutes. So, stand around in the noon-day heat for 45 minutes to get RAW food? And why couldn't we place an order in person? Forget it. The owner didn't care that we, along with the other half-dozen people who found out they couldn't order in person, decided to go elsewhere. I wish I had read the reviews before visiting Tassili's so I hadn't wasted our time.

First, the wrap was good and flavorful but we waited an hour in line for it. There were people who ordered online that were waiting longer that we were waiting. A young female kept saying they were short staffed. If they get better organization and perhaps more help, they'll do better. I believe that a business consultant is needed to guide this business to run efficiently and effectively because there potential. I love supporting black businesses but sometimes it's hard when the customer service is less than acceptable. No food is worth waiting an hour for however.
Dat ish! Wonderful first time trying their food and I think I'm addicted! So healthy and satisfying at the same time!

Good efforts,  but need a better technique for getting out orders.  Having to wait in line  for 45 min is un-acceptable and will eventually diminish business profits. 
I recommend  extending the sandwich prep table all the way across the front and putting the aft part on hinges so you can access the kitchen or the public area.  Either install a electronic order ticket system or install a simple rack so the cashier can  put the tickets up in order. Have the cashier order the tickets so that the work is evenly distributed.  Each worker making specifics wraps. Overall food atmosphere is good

One of my favorites, doesn't taste like typical vegan food. Loaded with flavor, I always get the south of the boarder w/ spicy kale extra mayo.
CALL IN YOUR ORDER-whenever your in a time crunch.

I absolutely love everything at this place.  Their wraps are delicious and their popcorn is healthy but taste great. I highly recommend. If you can place your order ahead of time do that because the wait can be long at times.

It's just tiring... $75 dollars worth of food for it to be wrong. Here's the thing... My order never changes. I may "order other items for others" so it's bigger but I order the same salad the same way but depending on who makes they "add" stuff to the order that's not on the order... Its just tiring.


The wait is long enough in addition to fight traffic (I mean it's Atlanta) and for it to be wrong the wait for correction is astronomical (you've already waited an hour or more) and there's no other real options of real resolution as emails go unanswered.

This is the third incident and again nothing on this menu is "fast food" priced, there should be a level of service that accompanies the quality of food being served. 

The customer support and care is lacking. 

When it's right it's good but when it's wrong it's literally nasty as it's not what you ordered or eat.
Greatest kale wraps ever! Highly recommended for any human that desires a great meal.

Was excited to try this place after seeing the great reviews. Ordered delivery two nights in a row. The half wraps are very big, leave you feeling full but also healthy. The Big Yoshi - Chili Wrap was stuffed with a lot of pad thai, some spicy kale, and creamy avocado. This definitely had heat! It was good, but I liked the Punany Spinach Wrap more- it was packed full of that amazing spicy kale salad, couscous, sweet corn, tomatoes, and avocado. This was amazing! Would definitely order again- maybe try it with the seaweed wrap? The tortilla style wrap was fine in the fridge overnight and still fresh for lunch the next day. IDK if seaweed would survive that. It looked like they had desserts on their website but when I ordered via Uber eats it wasn't an option... bummer, they looked good.
The food was great ,the employees were friendly,I really enjoyed it ,I wish I could have tried everything but I was able to sample a couple of items along with my purchase

I've been coming here for years, my favorite is the punany wrap and the popcorn. Best to order ahead of time as the long does get long, parking available on the street. Employees are always kind, positive energy atmosphere. I love supporting this local black business!
